s.orig-text: ¶ The right plesaunt and goodly historie of the foure sonnes of Aymon the which for the excellent endytyng of it , and for the notable prowes and great vertues that were in them : is no less pleasaunt to rede , then worthy to be knowen of all estates bothe hyghe and lowe .
s.parse: (S (: ¶) (NP (NP (DT The) (NML (JJ right) (NN plesaunt)) (CC and) (NML (RB goodly) (NN historie))) (IN of) (NP (NP (NP (DT the) (CD foure) (NNS sonnes)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNP Aymon)))) (NP (WHNP (DT the) (WHNP (WDT which))) (PP (PP (IN for) (NP (NP (DT the) (JJ excellent) (NN endytyng)) (PP (IN of) (NP (PRP it))))) (, ,) (CC and) (PP (IN for) (NP (NP (DT the) (JJ notable) (NNS prowes) (CC and) (JJ great) (NNS vertues)) (SBAR (WHNP (WDT that)) (S (VP (VBD were) (PP (IN in) (NP (PRP them)))))))))))) (: :) (VP (VBZ is) (NP (NP (NP (ADJP (RB no) (JJR less)) (NN pleasaunt)) (SBAR (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB rede)))))) (, ,) (ADVP (RB then)) (ADJP (JJ worthy) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB be) (VP (VB knowen) (PP (IN of) (NP (DT all) (NNS estates) (NML (FW bothe) (NN hyghe) (CC and) (NN lowe))))))))))) (. .))

comment.comtext: First page with title and a woodcut reproduced from the original print. The title reads as follows.

s.orig-text: The Prologue .
s.parse: (NP (DT The) (NNP Prologue) (. .))

comment.comtext: Woodcut image of four armed men on a horse here, removed
Edition has here, 'Beginning of the four sones of Aymon, taken from Copland's edition (C. 12, i. 7), British Museum, London, 1554.' in square brackets, deleted.
Introduction of edition states that this 1554 prologue 'is undoubtedly a literal reprint of Caxton's original preface.'

s.orig-text: As the philosopher , in the fyrst booke of hys metaphysyque , sayth , *that* every man / naturally desireth to know / and to con newe thynges : And therfore have the Clerkes / ＆ people / of great vnderstandynge desyred and concite to lerned sciences , and to know vertues of thinges .
s.parse: (S (PP (IN As) (NP (DT the) (NN philosopher))) (, ,) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (DT the) (JJS fyrst) (NN booke)) (PP (IN of) (NP (FW hys) (NN metaphysyque))))) (, ,) (VP (VBZ sayth)) (, ,) (SBAR (-LRB- *) (IN that) (-RRB- *) (S (NP (DT every) (NN man)) (CC /) (ADVP (RB naturally)) (VP (VP (MD desireth) (VP (TO to) (VP (VB know)))) (: /) (CC and) (VP (TO to) (VP (VB con) (NP (JJ newe) (NNS thynges))))))) (: :))

s.orig-text: Some by Phylosophy , other by Poetrye , and other by Historyes / and cronyikes / of thynges passed .
s.parse: (S (NP (NP (DT Some)) (PP (IN by) (NP (NNP Phylosophy)))) (, ,) (VP (NP (JJ other)) (PP (IN by) (NP (NNP Poetrye)))) (, ,) (CC and) (S (NP (NP (JJ other)) (PP (IN by) (NP (NP (NP (NNPS Historyes)) (: /) (CC and) (NP (NNS cronyikes)) (: /)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNS thynges)))))) (VP (VBD passed))) (. .))

s.orig-text: And vpo*n* these three they have greatly laboured / in suche *that* thanked be God , by theyr good dylygence / and laboures , they have had greate knowledge by innumerable volumes of bookes , whiche have be made / and compyled by great studye and payne / vnto thys day .

s.orig-text: And bycause that above all thinges , the princes ＆ lordes of hie estate and entendement / desyre to see thystoryes / of the ryght noble and hye vertues of the prodecessours / whiche ben digne , and worthy of remembraunce of perpetuall recommendation .
s.parse: (FRAG (CC And) (SBAR (IN bycause) (SBAR (IN that) (S (PP (IN above) (NP (DT all) (NNS thinges))) (, ,) (NP (DT the) (NNS princes) (CC ＆) (NNS lordes)) (IN of) (NP (FW hie) (NN estate)) (CC and) (NN entendement) (SYM /) (VBP desyre) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB see) (NP (NP (NP (NNS thystoryes)) (: /) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (DT the) (FW ryght) (JJ noble)) (CC and) (NP (NP (FW hye) (NNS vertues)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (NP (DT the) (NNS prodecessours)) (: /) (NP (FW whiche))) (VP (VBN ben) (ADJP (JJ digne))))))))) (, ,) (CC and) (ADJP (JJ worthy) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (NN remembraunce)) (PP (IN of) (NP (JJ perpetuall) (NN recommendation))))))))))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: Therfore , late at y^e^ request and commaundement of the ryght noble and vertus Erle Iohn , Erle of Oxeforde , my good synguler / and especial lorde , I reduced and translated out of Frenche , into our maternall and Englyshe tongue , the lyfe of one of his predecessoures , named Robert , Erle of Oxeforde , tofore sayd , w*ith* diverse ＆ many great myracles / whiche God shewed for him as wel in his lyfe / as after his death , as it is shewed all a longe in hys sayde booke .
s.parse: (S (ADVP (RB Therfore)) (, ,) (PP (RB late) (IN at) (NP (NP (-RRB- y^e^) (NN request) (CC and) (NN commaundement)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (NP (DT the) (JJ ryght) (JJ noble) (CC and) (NN vertus)) (NP (NNP Erle) (NNP Iohn))) (, ,) (NP (NP (NNP Erle)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNP Oxeforde)))) (, ,) (NP (NP (PRP$ my) (JJ good) (NN synguler)) (: /) (CC and) (NP (JJ especial) (NN lorde))))))) (, ,) (NP (PRP I)) (VP (VP (VBD reduced)) (CC and) (VP (VBN translated) (PP (IN out) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNP Frenche))))) (, ,) (PP (IN into) (NP (NP (PRP$ our) (ADJP (JJ maternall) (CC and) (JJ Englyshe)) (NN tongue)) (, ,) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN lyfe)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (NP (NP (CD one)) (PP (IN of) (NP (PRP$ his) (NNS predecessoures)))) (, ,) (VBN named) (NP (NNP Robert)) (, ,) (NP (NNP Erle)) (IN of) (NNP Oxeforde)) (, ,) (RB tofore) (VBN sayd) (, ,) (ADJP (JJ w*ith) ('' *) (ADJP (ADJP (JJ diverse)) (CC ＆) (ADJP (ADJP (JJ many)) (JJ great)))) (NNS myracles) (CC /) (SBAR (WHADVP (IN whiche)) (S (NP (NNP God)) (VP (VP (VBD shewed) (PP (PP (PP (IN for) (NP (PRP him))) (RB as) (RB wel)) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (PRP$ his) (NN lyfe)) (: /) (PP (IN as) (PP (IN after) (NP (PRP$ his) (NN death)))))))) (, ,) (PP (IN as) (NP (PRP it)) (VP (VBZ is) (VP (VBN shewed) (DT all) (NP (NP (DT a) (FW longe)) (PP (IN in) (NP (FW hys) (FW sayde) (FW booke)))))))))))))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: And also that my sayd Lorde / desyreth to have other Hystories of olde tyme / pa*sse*d of vertues chyvalry , reduced in lykewyse into our Englishe to*n*gue : he late sent to me a booke in Frenche , conteynyng thactes / and faytes of warre / doone and made agaynst y^e^ great Emperour and king of Fraunce , Charlemagne , by y^e^ .iiii. sonnes of Aymon , otherwyse named in Frenche , ' Les quatre fylz Aymon .
s.parse: (FRAG (CC And) (ADVP (RB also)) (SBAR (SBAR (IN that) (S (PRP$ my) (JJ sayd) (NNP Lorde) (CC /) (VP (MD desyreth) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB have) (S (NP (NP (JJ other) (NNS Hystories)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (NP (JJ olde) (NN tyme)) (CC /) (NP (NN pa*sse*d))) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNS vertues) (FW chyvalry)))))) (, ,) (VP (VBN reduced) (PP (IN in) (NP (NN lykewyse))) (PP (IN into) (NP (PRP$ our) (JJ Englishe) (NN to*n*gue))))))))))) (: :) (S (NP (PRP he)) (ADVP (RB late)) (VP (VBD sent) (PP (IN to) (NP (PRP me))) (NP (NP (NP (NP (DT a) (NN booke)) (PP (IN in) (NP (NNP Frenche)))) (, ,) (NP (NP (FW conteynyng) (NNS thactes)) (: /) (CC and) (NP (NP (NNS faytes)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NN warre) (CC /) (FW doone)))))) (CC and) (VP (VP (VBD made) (JJ agaynst) (-RRB- y^e^) (NP (JJ great) (NN Emperour))) (CC and) (NP (NP (NP (NN king)) (PP (PP (IN of) (NP (VB Fraunce))) (, ,) (NP (FW Charlemagne)))) (, ,) (PP (IN by) (NP (-RRB- y^e^) (FW .iiii))))))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: ' Whyche booke , accordynge to hys request , I have endevorde me to accomplyshe / and to reduce it into our englyshe , to my great coste / and charges , as in the translatinge / as in enprynting of the same , hopying ＆ not doubtyng / but that hys good grace / shall rewarde me in suche wise that I shall have cause to pray for his good and prosperus welfare .

s.orig-text: And besechynge his said noble good grace / to pardon me of y^e^ rude , and this simple worke .
s.parse: (S (CC And) (VP (VB besechynge) (NP (PRP$ his) (VBN said) (JJ noble) (JJ good) (NN grace)) (: /) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB pardon) (NP (PRP me)) (PP (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (-RRB- y^e^)) (ADJP (JJ rude)))) (, ,) (CC and) (NP (DT this) (JJ simple) (NN worke))))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: For , accordyng to the coppy / whyche he se*n*t to me , I have folowed as nigh as I can , and where as , as any defaute shall be founde , I submyt me to the correction of them / that vnderstande the cronycle ＆ history , besethyng the*m* to correcte it ＆ amende there / as they shall fynde faute .
s.parse: (FRAG (IN For) (, ,) (VBG accordyng) (PP (IN to) (NP (DT the) (NN coppy) (CC /) (FW whyche))))

s.orig-text: And I shall praye almighty God for them that so doo , to rewarde them in suche wyse , that after this shorte / and transytory lyfe , we all may come to everlastyng lyfe in heven .
s.parse: (S (CC And) (NP (PRP I)) (VP (MD shall) (VP (VB praye) (NP (JJ almighty) (NNP God)) (PP (IN for) (NP (PRP them))) (SBAR (IN that) (S (ADVP (RB so)) (RB doo) (, ,) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB rewarde) (NP (PRP them)) (PP (IN in) (NP (FW suche) (FW wyse)))))) (, ,) (SBAR (IN that) (S (PP (IN after) (NP (DT this) (FW shorte) (CC /) (CC and) (JJ transytory) (NN lyfe))) (, ,) (NP (NP (PRP we)) (NP (DT all))) (VP (MD may) (VP (VB come) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB everlastyng) (NP (NN lyfe)) (PP (IN in) (NP (NN heven)))))))))))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: Amen .
s.parse: (INTJ (UH Amen) (. .))

s.orig-text: ¶ Thus endeth the prologue : Heere foloweth the Table of this presente booke .
s.parse: (S (NFP ¶) (ADVP (RB Thus)) (VP (VBZ endeth) (NP (DT the) (NN prologue))) (: :) (S (NP (UH Heere)) (VP (VBZ foloweth) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN Table)) (PP (IN of) (NP (DT this) (JJ presente) (NN booke)))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: Who that wyll know the history of the foure noble and worthye knyghtes / named the foure sonnes of Aymon , wherof the fyrste was called Reynawde , the seconde Alarde , the thyrde Guycharde , and fourthe Rycharde , let hym fi*r*st reade this presente table folowynge / In whiche men shall fynde that thys presente booke conteyneth .xxviii. chapytres , whiche speaken of many faire / and dyverse matters , whiche they that shall reade thys sayde chapytres , shall nowe see the history all alonge .
s.parse: (S (SBAR (WHNP (WP Who)) (S (NP (WDT that)) (VP (MD wyll) (VP (VP (VB know) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN history)) (PP (IN of) (NP (DT the) (ADJP (CD foure) (JJ noble) (CC and) (JJ worthye)) (NNS knyghtes))))) (: /) (VP (VP (VBN named) (NP (NP (DT the) (CD foure) (NNS sonnes)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNP Aymon))))) (, ,) (SBAR (SBAR (IN wherof) (S (NP (DT the) (NN fyrste)) (VP (VBD was) (VP (VBN called) (S (NP (NNP Reynawde))))))) (, ,) (NP (DT the) (JJ seconde) (NNP Alarde)) (, ,) (NP (DT the) (NNP thyrde) (NNP Guycharde)) (, ,) (CC and) (NP (NNP fourthe) (NNP Rycharde)))))))) (, ,) (VP (VB let) (S (NP (FW hym) (FW fi*r*st)) (VP (VB reade) (NP (DT this) (JJ presente) (NN table) (FW folowynge))))) (: /))

s.orig-text: And ye shall see in this fyrst chapytre howe , that after kynge Charlemagne / was come agayne / from the partyes of Lombardy , where he had had great and merveyllouse battaylles / agenste the sarasyns , he helde vpon whitsondaye , open courte / at Parys , where was a fayre felawshyp of Prynces / and Barons , as ye shall heare after alonge .
s.parse: (S (CC And) (NP (PRP ye)) (VP (MD shall) (VP (VB see) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (DT this) (JJ fyrst)) (FW chapytre) (FW howe))) (, ,) (SBAR (IN that) (S (IN after) (NP (NP (NNP kynge) (NNP Charlemagne)) (: /)) (VP (VBD was) (VB come) (NP (NP (NN agayne)) (-RRB- /) (PP (IN from) (NP (NP (NP (DT the) (NNS partyes)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNP Lombardy)))) (, ,) (SBAR (WHADVP (WRB where)) (S (NP (PRP he)) (VP (VBD had) (VP (VBN had) (NP (NP (ADJP (JJ great) (CC and) (JJ merveyllouse)) (NNS battaylles)) (: /) (FW agenste) (NP (DT the) (NNS sarasyns))))))))))) (, ,) (NP (PRP he)) (VP (FW helde) (NP (FW vpon) (FW whitsondaye)) (, ,) (NP (JJ open) (FW courte)) (: /) (PP (IN at) (NP (NNP Parys))) (, ,) (SBAR (SBAR (WHADVP (WRB where)) (S (VP (VBD was) (NP (NP (NP (DT a) (NN fayre)) (NP (FW felawshyp))) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (NNS Prynces)) (: /) (CC and) (NP (NNS Barons)))))))) (, ,) (SBAR (IN as) (S (ADJP (NP (NN ye)) (VP (MD shall) (VP (VB heare) (PP (IN after) (NP (NN alonge)))))))))))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: And in the same chapitre / ye shall also see howe , the same daye / the duke Aymon of Ardeyne / broughte to the courte hys foure sonnes , that is to wit , Reynawde , Alarde , Guichard , and Richarde , and howe kynge Charlemagne / made theym knyghtes wyth his owne handes ; also howe the duke Benes of Aigremounce / slewe Lohier , the eldest sonne of kyng Charlemain ( the duke benes was vncle to the foure so*n*nes of Aymon ) ; and after , how the duke Benes of aygremount / was slaine coming to Paris , by the commaundemente of kinge Charlemagne , after that he had appointed , for the death of his sonne .
And also in this first chapitre / men shal nowe see many other faire matters , whiche were to longe for to be reherced / in this preambule of this present booke .
s.parse: (S (CC And) (ADVP (RB also)) (PP (IN in) (NP (DT this) (JJ first) (NN chapitre))) (: /) (NP (NNS men) (VBP shal)) (ADVP (VBP nowe)) (VP (VBP see) (NP (NP (JJ many) (JJ other) (JJ faire) (NNS matters)) (, ,) (SBAR (S (NP (DT whiche)) (VP (VBD were) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB longe) (SBAR (IN for) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB be) (VP (VBN reherced) (: /) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (DT this) (NN preambule)) (PP (IN of) (NP (DT this) (JJ present) (NN booke)))))))))))))))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: The seconde Chapyter sheweth howe Gryllon of haultefelle , and Guenes , after that they had slayne the duke Benes of Aygremount , retourned to Parys , and recounted to kynge Charlemagne / the mortall treason that they had put to execucyon ; wherof the kynge was ryghte glad ; and syn after he was ryghte sorye for it .

s.orig-text: For after that , the two bretherne of the duke Benes / made great warre agenst him , and so did Gerarde of Roussillon , and Dron , and Mawgys , the sonne of the duke Benes ; and after , they made peace and accorded togyther .

s.orig-text: But the kinge Charlemain accorded not with the foure sonnes of Aymon , nor to their cosin Mawgys .
s.parse: (S (CC But) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN kinge)) (NP (NNP Charlemain))) (VP (VBD accorded) (PP (RB not) (PP (IN with) (NP (NP (DT the) (JJ foure) (NNS sonnes)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNP Aymon))))) (, ,) (CC nor) (PP (IN to) (NP (PRP$ their) (NN cosin) (NNP Mawgys))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: Item howe Reynawde slew the nevew of king Charlemagne with a chesse boorde , as they plaied togyther at the chesse , wherof the warre began , the whiche was so mortall / and lasted so longe , that it bare a great dommage to the realme of Fraunce .
s.parse: (S (VP (VB Item) (SBAR (WRB howe) (S (NP (NNP Reynawde)) (VP (VBD slew))))))

comment.comtext: edition has here a black leaf symbol to indicate a gap

s.orig-text: The thirde chapitre speaketh , how after that kynge Charlemagne hadde made all his barons to forsake the foure sonnes of aymon / He went and besyeged them at mou*n*tenforde , where he was dyscomfyted two tymes ; but the castelle of Mou*n*tenforde was taken , after that , by tr*e*ason .
s.parse: (S (NP (DT The) (FW thirde) (NN chapitre)) (VP (VBD speaketh) (, ,) (SBAR (WHADVP (WRB how)) (S (PP (IN after) (NP (DT that) (NN kynge))) (NP (NNP Charlemagne) (NNP hadde)) (VP (VBD made) (S (NP (PDT all) (PRP$ his) (NNS barons)) (VP (TO to) (VP (VB forsake) (NP (NP (DT the) (CD foure) (NNS sonnes)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NN aymon))))))))))) (: /))

s.orig-text: And after , howe Reynawde and his bretherne avenged theim of the traytoures that betrayed theym , And after saved theym selfe wythin the forest of Ardeyne , Where theyr father found the*m* / as he went from the syege / to warde his londe of Dordon .

s.orig-text: And howe , for to keep his othe that he had made to kynge Charlemagne / He dyd assayle hys sonnes ; so that , of fyve hundred menne that they were , there abod on live with his sonnes but xvii. persones .

s.orig-text: But Reynawd and his brethern / had none evil , but slew many of their fathers men .
s.parse: (S (CC But) (NP (NP (NNP Reynawd)) (CC and) (NP (PRP$ his) (FW brethern))) (: /) (VP (VP (VBD had) (NP (NP (NN none)) (ADJP (JJ evil)))) (, ,) (CC but) (VP (VBD slew) (NP (NP (JJ many)) (PP (PP (IN of) (NP (PRP$ their) (NNS fathers))) (NP (NNS men)))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: The fourth chapytre sheweth how , after that the olde Aimon / had discomfyted his chyldren , they went and dwelled in the depest of the forest of Ardeyne , and abode there / tyll that they were al counterfayte blacke / and roughe / as wilde beastes , for the greate hungre that they had suffred ; and after , they went to Dordon / for to see their father , that made them good chere , and feasted them greately .

s.orig-text: And gave them of hauoyre so muche / that they myghte well make war with agenst the king ; and howe Mawgis their cosyn arryved , whan that they should have departed , whiche went with theym in to the realme of Gascoygne / with fyve hundred knightes .

s.orig-text: And whan theyr mother sawe them departe , she was for it full sorye .

s.orig-text: The fyfthe chaptre sheweth how , after that Reynawde / and hys brethern , with theyr cosyn mawgys , were departed from theyr mother / for to seeke their adventure / they went so longe tyll they came to the realme of Gascoygne .

s.orig-text: And howe / goynge thitherwarde , they made manye evylles in Fraunce .
s.parse: (S (CC And) (ADVP (UH howe) (SYM /) (UH goynge) (RB thitherwarde)) (, ,) (NP (PRP they)) (VP (VBD made) (NP (JJ manye) (NNS evylles)) (PP (IN in) (NP (NNP Fraunce)))) (. .))

s.orig-text: And howe the kynge of Gascoygn , wha*n* they were come there / dyd receive them in his servise ryghte sweetly , in bourdeux vpon Gyrond , by cause / that than this king of Gascoigne , that was called Yon , had warre agenst a kyng sarasin / that was entred into Gascoyne , that had to name Portus , that helde Tholouse and all the londe aboute .

s.orig-text: The VI chapter speaketh how Reinawde / and his bretherne / dystressed bourgous , a sarasyn that had distroyed the realme of Gascoign , and had chased the kinge yon / to bordeux vpon Gyronde , that durste not departe from thence , for feare of the sarasyns .
s.parse: (S (NP (DT The) (CD VI) (NN chapter)) (VP (VBZ speaketh) (SBAR (WHADVP (WRB how)) (S (NP (NNP Reinawde)) (: /) (CC and) (NP (PRP$ his) (NN bretherne) (-RRB- /)) (VP (VBD dystressed) (NP (NP (FW bourgous)) (, ,) (NP (NP (DT a) (NN sarasyn)) (SBAR (WHNP (WDT that)) (S (VP (VP (VBD had) (VP (VBN distroyed) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN realme)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNP Gascoign)))))) (, ,) (CC and) (VP (VBD had) (VP (VBN chased) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN kinge) (NN yon)) (: /)) (PP (PP (IN to) (NP (FW bordeux) (FW vpon) (NNP Gyronde))) (, ,) (SBAR (WHNP (WDT that)) (S (VP (VBP durste) (ADVP (RB not) (RB departe) (PP (IN from) (NP (NN thence)))))))) (, ,) (PP (IN for) (NP (NP (NN feare)) (PP (IN of) (NP (DT the) (NNS sarasyns)))))))))))))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: And howe kyng Yon gave his sister Clare / vnto Reinawde / to be hys wyfe , for the greate servyse / that he hadde doon to hym .
s.parse: (S (CC And) (RB howe) (FW kyng) (NNP Yon) (VP (VBD gave) (NP (PRP$ his) (NN sister)) (NNP Clare) (-LRB- /) (NNP vnto) (NNP Reinawde) (: /) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB be) (NP (FW hys) (FW wyfe))))) (, ,) (PP (IN for) (NP (NP (DT the) (JJ greate) (FW servyse)) (: /) (SBAR (IN that) (S (NP (PRP he)) (VP (VBD hadde) (NP (NN doon)) (PP (TO to) (NP (NN hym))))))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: And dyd doo make for hym the castell of Mountawban .
s.parse: (S (CC And) (NP (NN dyd) (NN doo)) (VP (VBP make) (PP (IN for) (NP (NN hym))) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN castell)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNP Mountawban))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: The seventh chapitre speaketh how Charlemagne , for a voyage that he made to saint Iames in Galyce , he knewe in his comynge agayne / howe Reynawde and his bretherne , that were his mortalle enmies , were in Gascoygne / with in a stronge castel , called Mountawban .
s.parse: (S (NP (DT The) (JJ seventh) (NN chapitre)) (VP (VBZ speaketh) (SBAR (WHADVP (WRB how)) (S (NP (NNP Charlemagne)) (, ,) (PP (IN for) (NP (NP (DT a) (NN voyage)) (SBAR (WHNP (WDT that)) (S (NP (PRP he)) (VP (VBD made) (PP (IN to) (NP (NN saint) (NNP Iames))) (PP (IN in) (NP (NNP Galyce)))))))) (, ,) (NP (PRP he)) (VP (VBD knewe) (PP (IN in) (NP (PRP$ his) (NN comynge) (FW agayne) (, /) (FW howe) (NP (NNP Reynawde)) (CC and) (NP (PRP$ his) (NN bretherne)))) (, ,) (SBAR (WHNP (WDT that)) (S (VP (VBD were) (NP (PRP$ his) (JJ mortalle) (NNS enmies))))) (, ,) (VP (VBD were) (PP (IN in) (NP (NNP Gascoygne))) (: /) (PP (IN with) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (DT a) (JJ stronge) (NN castel)) (, ,) (VP (VBN called) (S (NP (NNP Mountawban)))))))))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: And how he sente worde to kinge Yon , that he shoulde delyver to hym Reynawde and hys bretherne .

s.orig-text: And yf he refused to doo thys , he shoulde come and besyege hym in hys londe / afore X or XII moneths were passed ; Wherof ki*n*g Yon answered / that he shoulde not doo it .
s.parse: (S (CC And) (SBAR (ADVP (IN yf)) (S (NP (PRP he)) (VP (VBD refused) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB doo) (NP (NNS thys)))))))) (, ,) (S (S (NP (PRP he)) (VP (MD shoulde) (VP (VP (VB come)) (CC and) (VP (VB besyege) (NP (NN hym)) (PP (IN in) (NP (FW hys) (FW londe))))))) (: /) (S (IN afore) (NP (CD X) (CC or) (CD XII) (NNS moneths)) (VP (VBD were) (VP (VBN passed))))) (: ;) (S (NP (NNP Wherof) ('' ki*n*g) (NP (NNP Yon))) (VP (VBD answered) (: /) (SBAR (IN that) (S (NP (PRP he)) (VP (MD shoulde) (RB not) (VP (VB doo) (NP (PRP it)))))))) (. .))

s.orig-text: And howe , after that kynge Charlemagne / was retourned to Parys , Rowlande , his neuewes , arryved at Parys , whiche the kyng made knyght .
